fields.summary: Document session.secure setting and other console.ini options in a table/chart

comments.body:
[~hspencer]: I agree a chart/table explaining the configurable options in the console.ini file is a good plan.  cc'ing [~jloza] and [~tvo] to get their input.

For the AutoScaling configuration docs, let's revisit that after GUI-1359 is worked on.
Yes, that would be super helpful for admins and those setting up the console!

[~jloza], [~hspencer]: I've updated the title of this ticket to scope it to providing a documentation table/chart for the config options available in the console.ini file.  We should target this for 4.1 IMO, and feel free to assign it to me during the next bug scrub.

This file contains the settings an admin might use. [~tvo], this needs to get into some console administrator docs. I think this is where the content should be added: https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.0.2/index.html#shared/console_config_locating_config_file.html
[~hspencer], take a look at the attached file to see if that meets your needs.

[~tvo]: We recently added the ability to disable S3 file uploads, per GUI-1448, so we'll need to document the 'file.uploads.enabled' config setting as well.  The possible values are "true" or "false", with true as the default.

[~dkavanagh] and [~kgill]: please review and approve the attached section that now contains the table of all the configurable options in the console.ini file. I also put the file upload option right after the browser password save option on page 4, which is where it shows up in the actual console.ini file. Thanks!

I think it looks good. It's pretty dense, but not sure that we can do much about that.
The file.uploads.enabled option is not required though. We default to "true" which disables file uploads if the value is not present. Question for [~kgill], where we read the setting: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1187/files#diff-abe27a80d320ff269b8d786d69ee2f18R91
If the value is not in the console.ini, does it raise a KeyError (or something simliar)? I want to check because if at all possible, when we add new values to the console.ini between versions, not requiring those is the best thing to avoid odd errors for the user if they kept their old config file.

The following console.ini values aren't required, as the console falls back to default values if the setting is missing…

- static.cache.duration (defaults to 43200 seconds)
- browser.password.save (defaults to 'true')
- connection.ssl.validation (defaults to 'false')
- connection.retries (defaults to '2')
- file.uploads.enabled (defaults to 'true')
- pyramid.default_locale_name (defaults to 'en')
- session.secure (defaults to 'false')

We should strongly consider adding a "Default value" column in the table to clarify what the default values are when the setting isn't required.

And we should add default lookups for the following settings…

- connection.debug (should default to False in config.py, suggesting we change it to the following)…
{code}
settings.get('connection.debug', False)
{code}
- aws.default.region (defaults to 'us-east-1' in login.py but not in layout.py)
I've changed layout.py, but per your link to asbool(), we don't need to set a default for connection.debug since that's wrapped with asbool()

PR 1203 merged, but punting this back to [~tvo] to update the table with the correct values for the "Required" column.  Also strongly suggest we add a "Default Value" column to clarify what the values are when a non-required config setting isn't provided.

[~kgill] and [~dkavanagh], please see the attached and let me know if it reflects the correct changes. I am still unsure whether file.uploads.enabled if kept at default of 'true' means they CAN or CANNOT upload files for s4/object storage. Intuitively, it makes sense if true means they can and false means it is disabled......

The one comment is related to the clchost and s3.host and S3 downloads.
"For S3 downloads..." This is mentioned in the clchost section. I feel like some more words could be useful. s3.host could be set independently to have the same effect, but I'm not sure how much we should discuss since we don't want to create confusion. So, I wonder if having a paragraph outside the table would be useful (Maybe as a note referenced in the table under both entries?)
Upon discussing with [~dkavanagh], he was good with describing the options available in the clchost property with respect to the S3 downloads.
[~alice] and [~ccassler]: Please review the attached section and provide any inputs or changes. Thanks!

[~tvo]: A few minor corrections should be made to the table...

{code}
clcport: defaults to 8773
aws.enabled: defaults to true
aws.default.region: defaults to us-east-1
connection.debug: defaults to false
host: defaults to 0.0.0.0
port: defaults to 8888
{code}

Note that the defaults are specified in the config file at conf/console.default.ini
Got it! I'm committing these changes now. Thanks [~kgill]!
